Class PayingPassenger

java.lang.Object
  Passenger
      PayingPassenger
All Implemented Interfaces:
Chargeable, Weighable
public abstract class PayingPassenger
extends Passenger
implements Chargeable

Abstract class PayingPassenger - This class gets the base fare and type charge for every single passenger and then calculates the total charge for that passenger and then prints out all the data for that passenger.

Version:

Constructor Detail

PayingPassenger

public PayingPassenger(java.lang.String firstName,
                       java.lang.String lastName,
                       double weight,
                       int passengerNumber,
                       double baseFare,
                       double typeCharge)
Constructor method ensures that when a passenger is created, the base fare and type charge are included in the instantiation

Parameters:
firstName - passengers first name
lastName - passengers last name
weight - passengers body weight
passengerNumber - passengers ID number
baseFare - passengers base amount to pay based on the route
typeCharge - passengers amount to pay based on cabin class type Again, this will vary depending on the route and the type of passenger (eg. Business or Econ. or 1st C.)
Method Detail

getBaseFare

public double getBaseFare()
Accessor method to acquire base fare for the passenger

Returns:
A double that is the base fare for the passenger based on their route

getCharge

public double getCharge()
Accessor method that gets the total charge for passenger

Specified by:
getCharge in interface Chargeable
Returns:
A double that is the total amount the passenger has to pay based on the passengers base fare, weight and type charge

getTypeCharge

public double getTypeCharge()
Accessor method to acquire type charge for the passenger

Returns:
A double that is the type charge for the passenger based on their cabin class

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Neatly displays the costs that the passenger has

Overrides:
toString in class Passenger
Returns:
A set of strings, where each string is an amount of money the passenger has to pay
